intro: Ursinia pauciloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ursinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow-orange flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Ursinia pauciloba is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
